fields.description:
The euca_conf --deregister-service command often gives an error but the result of the operation is a success. If you describe immediately after the operation returns you will sometimes see API_\*.euare and API_\*.tokens are still enabled but they go away in a moment or so.

Steps:
# register a new UFS host ex. {{euca_conf --register-service -T user-api --host 10.111.1.174 -N API_174}}
# check services are enabled
# deregister UFS ex.{{euca_conf --deregister-service -T user-api -N API_174}}
# wait, wait, wait, error is reported
# check describe services, you may catch that some of the user services are still listed and enabled
# check again a minute later and everything is as expected and UFS are all deregistered

output
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# euca_conf --deregister-service -T user-api -N API_174
error: deregistration failed
ERROR	Failed to deregister user-api: API_174 because of : Failed to lookup any registered component with the name: API_174
{code}

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/0H3C37323O3s1y3M3F1H/WeinerDog.jpg|align=center, vspace=4!

Full sequence of register/describe/deregister/describe
{code}

comments.body: Fixed by merge of 4.0.1 to testing.
